shared.sourceOrg: Office for Health Improvement and Disparities
shared.caveats:
The data presented only includes children participating in the National Child Measurement Programme (NCMP) in state maintained schools, any measurements taken at independent and special schools are excluded from the analysis.

Children are classified as (centiles are of the British 1990 growth reference (UK90) according to age and sex):

- Underweight if their body mass index (BMI) is less than the 2nd centile.

- Healthy weight if their body mass index (BMI) is between the 2nd and less than the 85th centile.

- Overweight if their body mass index (BMI) is on or above the 85th centile, but less than the 95th centile.

- Living with obesity if their body mass index (BMI) is on or above the 95th centile.

 The data source combines the City of London totals with Hackney, and the Isles of Scilly totals with Cornwall to prevent potential disclosure of individuals. Explore Local Statistics cannot visualise data for combined areas so please refer to the original data source for this data. 

 Impact of Covid: Usually 95% of the state sector pupils are covered by these data. Coverage reduced in 2019/20 to 75% and further in 2020/21 to around 10%. As a result completeness is low especially in 2020/21 when few Local Authorities can be published. By 2021/22 coverage, at 92%, was almost back to normal levels. Further information is available from the data supplier.

Aged four to five years underweight.label: Underweight prevalence in children at reception age
Aged four to five years underweight.subtitle: Percentage of children aged 4 to 5 classified as underweight
Aged four to five years underweight.longDescription: This indicator shows the percentage of children aged 4-5 years (reception age) classified as underweight, in England, for academic years 2006/07 to 2023/24.

Aged four to five years healthy weight.label: Healthy weight prevalence in children at reception age
Aged four to five years healthy weight.subtitle: Percentage of children aged 4 to 5 classified as at a healthy weight
Aged four to five years healthy weight.longDescription: This indicator shows the percentage of children aged 4-5 years (reception age) classified as healthy weight, in England, for academic years 2006/07 to 2023/24.

Aged four to five years overweight.label: Overweight prevalence in children at reception age
Aged four to five years overweight.subtitle: Percentage of children aged 4 to 5 classified as overweight
Aged four to five years overweight.longDescription: This indicator shows the percentage of children aged 4-5 years (reception age) classified as overweight, in England, for academic years 2006/07 to 2023/24.

Aged four to five years obese.label: Obesity prevalence in children at reception age
Aged four to five years obese.subtitle: Percentage of children aged 4 to 5 classified as living with obesity
Aged four to five years obese.longDescription: This indicator shows the percentage of children aged 4-5 years (reception age) classified as living with obesity (including severe obesity), in England, for academic years 2006/07 to 2023/24.

Aged 10 to 11 years underweight.label: Underweight prevalence in children at Year 6 age
Aged 10 to 11 years underweight.subtitle: Percentage of children aged 10 to 11 classified as underweight
Aged 10 to 11 years underweight.longDescription: This indicator shows the percentage of children aged 10-11 years (Year 6 age) classified as underweight, in England, for academic years 2006/07 to 2023/24.

Aged 10 to 11 years healthy weight.label: Healthy weight prevalence in children at Year 6 age
Aged 10 to 11 years healthy weight.subtitle: Percentage of children aged 10 to 11 classified as at a healthy weight
Aged 10 to 11 years healthy weight.longDescription: This indicator shows the percentage of children aged 10-11 years (Year 6 age) classified as healthy weight, in England, for academic years 2006/07 to 2023/24.

Aged 10 to 11 years overweight.label: Overweight prevalence in children at Year 6 age
Aged 10 to 11 years overweight.subtitle: Percentage of children aged 10 to 11 classified as overweight
Aged 10 to 11 years overweight.longDescription: This indicator shows the percentage of children aged 10-11 years (Year 6 age) classified as overweight, in England, for academic years 2006/07 to 2023/24.

Aged 10 to 11 years obese.label: Obesity prevalence in children at Year 6 age
Aged 10 to 11 years obese.subtitle: Percentage of children aged 10 to 11 classified as living with obesity
Aged 10 to 11 years obese.longDescription: This indicator shows the percentage of children aged 10-11 years (Year 6 age) classified as living with obesity (including severe obesity), in England, for academic years 2006/07 to 2023/24.
